We're growing! Keen to join the team? Follow us on LinkedIn , where we post job openings. Tell us about yourself. How can we help? About Mothership News Videos Offbeat Perspectives Lifestyle International + More About Search Search ← Back Perspectives Lifestyle International Community History (1819) Almost Famous / Six Minutes MPs in the House Can or Not Polls About News Videos Offbeat Perspectives Lifestyle International + More About Search ← Back Community History (1819) Almost Famous / Six Minutes MPs in the House Can or Not Polls Go About Mothership Mothership is a Singaporean community content aggregator for the digital age. We connect with our audiences by creating high quality multimedia stories and entertainment content that encourages social sharing. Mothership helps brands and businesses speak with digital audiences through our content marketing, community marketing and social advertising services. Mothership is the fastest growing digital platform in Singapore in 2015. It currently attracts a viewership of 3,800,000 each month. Advertise with us Thanks for visiting Mothership! If youâve a project or an advertising campaign and want to reach out to Singaporean readers, weâd love to explore ways in which we can help you. Advertorial article we did for a client Video content we did for a client Here are just some of the ways weâve helped businesses reach our fast-growing audience: Advertorial articles (like this one , this one , and this one ) Sponsored video content (such as this video and also this video ) Pinned advertorial content on our Facebook page Pinned advertorial content on our Home page Pinned advertorial contnet on our various category pages (such as our News page and Offbeat page ) And many more (secret) creative solutions Drop us a line at sales@mothership.sg and letâs talk! Contact us Have something youâll like to tell us? You can reach us at info@mothership.sg . Want to stalk us instead? You can follow us on Facebook and Twitter . Join us To join us as a freelance writer and photographer, please send us your resume at info@mothership.sg . If you are keen to contribute articles to Mothership.sg, you can also contact us at the same email (info@mothership.sg). Contributors â Team Mothership Martino Tan Managing editor Martinoâs parents named him after an Italian priest, Vaticanâs 1st ambassador to Sâpore. Heâs inspired by the lives of Robert Kennedy & D. Bonhoeffer, the words of G.Orwell & T.Sorensen, & the music of the Beatles. Chan Cheow Pong Managing editor It took Cheow Pong two decades to recover from the trauma of memorising General Paper essays before he was ready to be an English writer. In between affliction and recovery, he thoroughly enjoyed his time writing in Chinese and doing Chinese translations. He is a recovering mobile phone addict. Lien We King Towkay We Kingâs dream job is to be a supermarket assistant at the frozen food section. He also wishes to be an animal keeper in the elephantâs enclosure at any wildlife reserve that would hire him. He aspires to travel to the Galapagos Islands before he grows old. Belmont Lay Editor Belmont wrote about friskiness in his Yahoo! News column, mishandles the 3rd most overrated website in Singapore and can pronounce âtchotchkeâ. Donât follow him. Heâs not Jesus. Jonathan Lim Editor Jon is usually at home watching random videos YouTube recommends him. He hopes to strike Toto so he can live off rental income and watch more YouTube videos. Tan Xing Qi Writer In between episodes of Breaking Bad and The Sopranos, Xing Qi deals T-Shirts to unsuspecting Singaporeans through a roadside stall, which, ironically, is not a physical stall. Daniel Ho Writer Daniel Ho is in the business of bringing people together to pursue the unimaginable. He dreams of one day living on a farm, surrounded only by limitless plains and free-roaming livestock. For now, he can only wonder what freak of nature caused him to land up here at the Mothership. He Ruiming Writer Ruiming is a freelance writer that has lived in Singapore, Melbourne and Hongkong. When heâs not being snarky on Mothership or waddling waist-deep in deadlines, he finds time for lifeâs simple pleasures: Teh-O Peng, Lao Gan Ma chilli oil and HBOâs award-winning TV series Game Of Thrones. Henedick Chng Writer Henedick loves food. He is always hungry. In between his eating binges, he cooks and is just another food blogger who anyhow shares his recipes and dining adventures with the world. Gerald Chan Writer Caught between the love of LEGO, video and board games, Gerald plots to make every video viral daily but to no avail. Jeanette Tan Writer Apart from being a professional busybody, Jeanette takes pride in her ability to sing the complete lyrics to Hakuna Matata and a host of other Disney songs. She still holds out hope to someday be talent-spotted to do voice-overs for documentaries, lifts and automated telephone answering systems. 3rd Planet Brewing Registered for the 2024 Emerald Coast Beer Festival Online Tickets are Now Available. Buy Now! Sept. 5th, 2025 Pensacola, FL Buy Tickets Sept. 5th, 2025 Pensacola, FL Sept. 5th, 2025 Pensacola, FL Tickets Confirmed Brewers At The Festival Beer Tasting Beer List Beer Pairing Dinner Live Music Food Vendors Fest App & Program Vendors Fest Info FAQ Contact Organizers About The Venue Fest History Facebook Event Brewers Only Buy Tickets Fest App Brewery Registration Info Home At The Fest Confirmed Brewers Brewer Registration 2024 Emerald Coast Beer Fest Registration 3rd Planet Brewing Brewery                        in Niceville, FL Website, Social Links, and Location Brewery Address 1400 E John Sims Pkwy Niceville, FL 32578 Beers Registered (3) Mullet Lite American Light Lager Standard American Beer Package Highly carbonated, very light-bodied, nearly flavorless lager designed to be consumed very cold. Very refreshing and thirst quenching. ABV:  2.8% to 4.2% IBU:  8 to 12 Dank Side of the Moon Hazy IPA American IPA IPA Package A decidedly hoppy and bitter, moderately strong American pale ale, showcasing modern American or New World hop varieties. The balance is hop-forward, with a clean fermentation profile, dryish finish, and clean, supporting malt allowing a creative range of hop character to shine through. ABV:  5.5% to 7.5% IBU:  40 to 70 Drunkin' Pumpkin Fruit and Spice Beer Fruit Beer Package A harmonious marriage of fruit, spice, and beer, but still recognizable as a beer. The fruit and spice character should each be evident but in balance with the beer, not so forward as to suggest an artificial product. Back to Confirmed Brewers Be Social Please Take a Moment and SHARE this Event with Family and Friends Follow us on Facebook to receive the most current information about the festival! Join Our Facebook Facebook Event Organized by Join Our Club Portion of the Proceeds Benefit #ECBeerFest Event hosted at Seville Quarter Seville Quarter 130 E Government St Pensacola, FL 32502 info@emeraldcoastbeerfestival.com Tickets: (850) 384-6415 © 2025 Emerald Coast Beer Festival | Privacy Policy

3rd Planet Brewing - The Mothership - Niceville FL Brewery Brew it, Drink it! Join EBHB Menu Calendar Event Calendar Style of the Month Past Events Board Meeting Minutes Info Event Signup FAQ Pensacola Breweries Pensacola Craft Beers News Newsletters About Our Mission Photo Gallery Winos Emerald Coast Beerfest Club Officers Bylaws Brewing Resources Brewer Marketplace Homebrew Supply Shops Beer Style Guidelines Resourceful Links Home > Breweries > Micro Brewery in Niceville, FL 3rd Planet Brewing - The Mothership Rating - 4.8 out of 5 stars Review Count from Google Places: 222 Micro Brewery 1400 E John Sims Pkwy, Niceville, FL 32578, USA http://3rdplanetbrewing.com/ (850) 424-4257 Beer List List is sorted by most popular at location. First beers are most likely their regular beers while the end of 
						the list are most likely their sesonal beers. Beers updated every month. Dank Side of the Moon IPA - New England / Hazy 7.5% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Straw colored slightly cloudy IPA with great taste smoothness without over hopped bitterness. Bluewater Hefeweizen Wheat Beer - Hefeweizen 5.7% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Brewed with local honey Boggy Bayou Stout Stout - Milk / Sweet 5.5% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Luminous Cloud Pale Ale - New England / Hazy 5.2% ABV ▪ 30 IBU Hazy Pale Ale with 20% oats in the grain bill and dry-hopped with Centennial, Comet, and Amarillo. Bear Creek Bramber Brown Ale - American 5.7% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Amber beer brewed in the English brown style. West Coast Hipster IPA - American 7.3% ABV ▪ N/A IBU West Coast IPA heavily dry-hopped with Simcoe, Centennial, and Columbus hops. Drunkin’ Pumpkin Pumpkin / Yam Beer 5.5% ABV ▪ 17 IBU Over 10 pounds of pumpkin used per barrel give this beer a rich color and mouthfeel. Combined w/ the perfect amount of spice, this ale has a clean finish that isn't too sweet. Panhandle Pale Ale Pale Ale - American 5.9% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Pale Beach Bohemian Pilsner - Czech / Bohemian 5.2% ABV ▪ 34 IBU Post'l Point Porter Porter - English 8.1% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Cosmic Origins Stout - Imperial / Double 11% ABV ▪ 50 IBU Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout with Cinnamon & Madagascar Vanilla. Crow Cream Ale Cream Ale 5.6% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Emulator Bock - Doppelbock 8.6% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Doppelbock style beer Choctaw-hoppee IPA IPA - American 7.1% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Rising Sands Lager - Japanese Rice 4.3% ABV ▪ 20 IBU International Pale Lager with 70% Barke Pilsner Malt and 30% Brown Rice Flakes. A large whirlpool addition of Saaz hops provides subtle floral, grass, and spice notes. Paddy’s Pint Stout - Irish Dry 5.3% ABV ▪ 24 IBU Classic Dry Irish Stout with Fawcett Pearl Malt, Flaked and Roasted Barley. Hopped with East Kent Goldings and Fuggles. Mullet Lite Lager - American Light 4.6% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Bear Creek Brown Brown Ale - Other 5.7% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Red Eye Gravy Brown Ale - American 5.8% ABV ▪ N/A IBU Smooth brown ale mixed with cold brew coffee. Hazy and delicious! Mother of Hubble Lager - IPL (India Pale Lager) 7.4% ABV ▪ 50 IBU Brewed in celebration of International Women’s Day 2020, the women of Odd Colony and Idyll Hounds joined our ladies to brew this IPL hopped exclusively with YCH’s 2019 Pink Boots Blend. Wave of Lupulation IPA - American 6.7% ABV ▪ N/A IBU A double dry hopped American IPA with fresh local peaches added. The peach, citrus, and tropical notes of the fruit and hops are rounded out by copious amounts of lactose and vanilla. Citra Blonde Ale Blonde / Golden Ale - Other N/A ABV ▪ N/A IBU Turkey Creek Trippel Belgian Tripel N/A ABV ▪ N/A IBU Prostbräu Märzen 6% ABV ▪ 30 IBU Fruit Sequence: Tiki Party Sour - Fruited 5.1% ABV ▪ 15 IBU Painkiller Tiki Cocktail-inspired golden sour with Pineapple, Coconut, Orange, Vanilla, Dark Brown Sugar, and Nutmeg. 3rd Planet Brewing is Niceville, FL’s first craft brewery that created a vibrant atmosphere in the community.  3rd Planet Brewing opened the “Launchpad” in April 2016 brewing 8 quality in-house taproom craft beers on a 2-barrel Ruby Street system.  The goal was to serve great tasting craft beer in a cool taproom that the community supported.  3rd Planet Brewing focused on in-house sales, quality beer in a comfortable environment, and exceptional customer service. The two original owners and founders Tim McCool and Jason Doster are military veterans and engineers.  They decided that producing a quality product in a cool environment would result in natural growth leading to distribution.  Another key decision was to utilize food trucks and create a “food-friendly” environment allowing the customers to bring in food too.  At the time Niceville did not have an ordinance allowing food trucks, so the owners worked hand-in-hand with the city to establish a food truck ordinance prior to opening their 2nd location. Show Map Amenities Food Available Show Reviews (5) Reviews Reviews are from the Google's Places community and NOT from EBHB club members. Claire Smith I feel like this is Niceville's Proof equivalent. That being said, it's a very cool space but very crowded. Beer in our flights were good; the milk stout especially tasty. Didn't get a lot of normal pics because they were doing a charity beard contest that my husband got reeled into, even though he just shaved! That event made our visit a little chaotic. Would like to go back during the week when we can enjoy the general atmosphere a bit more. Rated 4 out of 5 Benjamin LaFrancois The absolute best brewery in Florida. These guys know what they are doing when it comes to beer. My favorite beer is the Dank Side of the Moon. Choose your favorite, but whatever you choose, you can't go wrong. Not only is the beer good but the atmosphere is great! When it's not raining (like it does every day in FL) the outdoor set up is an outstanding setup for your kids, or cornhole. Music bingo on Thursday, and live bands almost every Friday and Saturday. Make yourself a regular at this brewery and you won't regret it. Rated 5 out of 5 D Gresham Enjoyed the food truck and really enjoyed the beer. Great selection, which changes infrequently, and the staff is always friendly. The music was great; although, a bit loud to hold a conversation with friends. I'll definitely be going back again and again. Rated 5 out of 5 Mandy McCollough Such a fun place and very family friendly! I enjoyed the beers I tried and love that they bring different food trucks in to choose from. We went while there was live music too, which was awesome! They have a big open area outside for kids to run around which made going out with a toddler much more enjoyable. We will definitely be going back! Rated 5 out of 5 Danielle Alexander Great space! Lots of three season outdoor seating with heaters, lawn games and more. Family and dog friendly for an afternoon of relaxing with a cold beer and bite to eat. Rated 5 out of 5 Photos View Photos Share this Page Hours Monday: 3:00 – 9:00 PM Tuesday: 3:00 – 9:00 PM Wednesday: 3:00 – 9:00 PM Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM Emerald Coast Beer Festival is the longest running beer festival in Pensacola, FL!
